keyword: calories in one pound of ground turkey
title: Calories in One Pound of Ground Turkey
meta_description: Learn calories in one pound of ground turkey, plus protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition per 100 g basis, and cooking tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: Calories in One Pound of Ground Turkey
assumptions: 93% lean ground turkey, raw; 1 pound ≈ 454 g; uncooked unless specified.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, brand, fat content, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One pound of 93% lean ground turkey provides ~681 kcal and ~85 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Cooked and drained (vs. raw; weight loss but calories similar)
Add 1 tbsp oil for cooking per pound

faqs.q: How many calories in one pound of ground turkey?
faqs.a: About 681 kcal for 93% lean, raw ground turkey.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one pound of ground turkey?
Does cooking change calories in ground turkey?
faqs.a: Calories per gram may increase due to water loss, but total calories remain similar if no fat is drained.

faqs.q: How does lean percentage affect calories in ground turkey?
faqs.a: Lower lean (e.g., 85%) adds ~50-60 kcal per pound due to more fat.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground turkey?
faqs.a: Raw; cooked values depend on method—grilling drains fat, reducing totals slightly.
